text:
Hey everyone -
I just noticed that the legacy api documentation is now redirecting to the new docs. Is this intended? I did not see any news about this getting deactivated.

Hello and thanks for the information.  When I look at what is available on Settings, I do not see anything like Account or Setting Access tabs.

I have inherited the “management” of our HubSpot platform and the SI is no longer around.
like a v1 api?
I doubt it is sunset, just the documetnation
but could be mistake
you have a link?

<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/analytics/analytics-overview>

I also don't think the underlying API got deprecated, I just find myself sometimes browsing the legacy docs for old integrations and noticed that I cannot access it anymore.

<@U05UV02FUP7> - check out the linked article. My screenshots are from within the user permissions page - you need to be in Users and Teams > create a permission set or be asssigning permissions to a single user, then you’ll see this
If you need further help, HubSpot Support can help out
yeah this sucks
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/deprecated/overview>
yeah, nothing sunset
Your best bet would be wayback machine
Is there a way to see replays for this event or get in on the ongoing sessions? <@U03REFNRMB3>
<@U07U4T7K9AL>, if you didn’t make the first week, you’ll need to wait for the next Bootcamp, which I believe will be Winter
okay thanks Justin

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!

Thank you Anton. I've used content staging to make minor updates but now we are migrating a site from the template designer to a custom theme.  I kept worrying that pulling a page into content staging and assigning a new theme template would somehow mess with the live page. I need to get my head I guess.

The legacy docs from the link you provided showed the `v2` endpoint which you may visit the references for those here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/analytics-and-events/reporting/v2>
does anyone have a good resource / example of how to setup pagination when you have a graphQL file pulling a few thousand records into a module?

Thanks I found it

Now my question is - for a frontend developer - what permissions should/need be assigned to them - in order to avoid setting them as super admin

Generally, they will need ability to access/create standbox, work in content staging, custom apps, hubdb etc.

Besides supporting the CMS website, they are doing a POC to test out the capability of using CMS/Content in a full composible headless decoupled fashion.  Using, for example external webserver running angular that will need to fetch a page from CMS and then render it on this webserver where it will be injected with data from say a ecomemrce platform
You likely want to review the permissions that are part of both the "Developer" and "CMS Developer" preset templates
Then you can edit/update from those starting points
did anybody just experience a weird redirect glitch on your HubSpot hosted pages? one of our pages started to "redirect too many times" and crashed
but doesn't seem to be connected to anything
Why can we not use Bold and Italic buttons in rich text when working with custom fonts? This is very confusing for our content creators.

Hey <@U2H3TT8F2> thanks! I actually picked a URL randomly - we have used some v1 endpoints for form related automations which I guess I cannot access directly anymore.

In the end I just wanted to understand if this redirect was done on purpose as I did not see any information about this anywhere.
